subject: [Cpplint] Single source tree
commitMessage:
[Cpplint] Single source tree

cpplint.py requires consistent single source code tree.
Otherwise some rules may not apply.

Running:
cpplint.py --root-dir=src/

Will obligate each header file to have correct guard macro.
This will be fixed in future.

===========================================================
To run stylecheck type:
./tools/check-coding-style
===========================================================

Change-Id: I05b62b09ce789648a11a305279adcf8ea5a70d51

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: namespaces reorganization
commitMessage:
namespaces reorganization

* common_installer {} - this namespace includes all app-installers definitions
  (Step,  ContextInstaller, utils, AppInstaller)

* utils {} - this namespace includes all extra definitions that are
  not directly related to app-installer framework and are used within
  the project (eg. logging, "dirs" handling, design patterns primitives
  (eg. singleton) etc)

* common/unzip {} - this is a namespace that includes unzipping step
  and its additional definitions

* common/signature {} - this is a namespace that includes signature step
  and its additional definitions

* common/copy {}, common/register {}, etc - these namespaces are
  analogic to unzip or signature

* wgt {} - this is a namespace that includes definitions specified for
  wgt type installation

* wgt/parse {} - this is a namespace that includes parsing step
  specified for wgt type installation

Change-Id: I9fbc542e9184def7bbd6955837c506ccf32825e3
Signed-off-by: Pawel Sikorski <p.sikorski@samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Baptiste DURAND <baptiste.durand@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

commitMessage:
rework step unzip

- add GetApplicationPath() method to ContextInstaller class
    in order to get user application path.

    and add tzplatform-config dependency.

- define 'utils' namespace in context_installer source files.
For the moment there is only one function to create a directory, that's why I put it in context_installer.h.
When there will be other functions, why not moving it in 'utils' source files.

- add GetApplicationPath() method in ContextInstaller class.

subject: Signature implementation moved from xwalk
commitMessage:
Signature implementation moved from xwalk

This is digital signature implementation moved from xwalk.
It is based on following PRs:
 - https://github.com/crosswalk-project/crosswalk/pull/2169
 - https://github.com/crosswalk-project/crosswalk/pull/2291
 - https://github.com/crosswalk-project/crosswalk/pull/2422

There are some not solved issues:
 - test correctness for valid widgets,
 - seperation from managing root certificate,
 - style of this code.

[[ PLEASE NOTE THE COMMIT CONTAINS CROSSWALK'S BSD-STYLE LICENSE ]]

Change-Id: I42db7e8a02b44a88ca88d143ad034fd1e253f3e2
Signed-off-by: Pawel Sikorski <p.sikorski@samsung.com>

subject: Inotroducing std::string for pkgid, file_name, unpack_directory of InstallerContext. Thanks to that these fields are automatically alloacted/deallocated (no need to call free in case of errors, in case of clean/undo steps, etc)
commitMessage:
Inotroducing std::string for pkgid, file_name, unpack_directory of
InstallerContext.
Thanks to that these fields are automatically alloacted/deallocated
(no need to call free in case of errors, in case of clean/undo steps, etc)

Additionally, "const char *" instead of "char *" in
* extractTo_u,
* unzip_u

Change-Id: Id16cbf1c7ece36024e197c07f6e05a149d8f1324
Signed-off-by: Pawel Sikorski <p.sikorski@samsung.com>

Style check rules fix

-runtime/references - this rules was not relevant to code

./tools/check-coding-style

Change-Id: Ie367dd5bfd44c5ea8bb64b4640e443212907863a

comments.message:
Patch Set 2:

Style check was not agreed.

I did some investigation.
There are many changes to apply this style guide:
- files extensions: .h, .cc - required,
- single source code tree (no multiple src or include directories) - the way cpplint works,
- naming methods, variables,
- spaces instead of tabs...

And more.

Therefore reverting.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

I would prefer to leave this script here.
we could also start to iteratively fix the style errors you mentioned...

As you mentioned:
* [DONE] files extensions 
* [TODO] spaces instead of tabs
* [TODO] naming methods
* [TODO] Single source code tree

Patch Set 2:

After discussion with Pawel, I will leave this script.
Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased

Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Could you please share what parameters/command you use with this script?
Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated

I am merging it (as Baptiste is on Holidays :))
Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Add Skeleton and basis class

Add Skeleton and basis class

Change-Id: I90aeaef9904c173ea5cd76d38ba874e9f5e239fc
Signed-off-by: Baptiste DURAND <baptiste.durand@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Hi, during the conference call, I mentioned some general review points. Let me write them here:
* MIT license? as we would use some part of wrt, vcore, crosswalk code, maybe we should consider different license
* formatting - what sourcecode style will we use? maybe the one used in crosswalk.
* do we use exceptions? in crosswalk they are not used, AFAIK. but here, they would look useful (in my opinion)
* is there a difference between .h and .hxx files? if not, maybe lets use unified extension for header files (as it is for source files). 
* what do you think about keeping step-* files in the separate subdirectory (eg common/src/step/step-unzip.cxx). or even (in the future), maybe we should introduce install/uninstall/update sub-dirs for these types of steps

Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

some comments

Patch Set 5:

How about use Google C++ Style?
http://google-styleguide.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/cppguide.html

or Please define any rules for coding style.

Patch Set 1:

@wonYoung Choi: yes, we agree to use the google style. We are preparing such code style changes and will submit it

Patch Set 5:

Are we considering using full C++11 as there is no need to support other platforms as in case of chromium?

Patch Set 5: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

Tomasz Ivamnek changes will fixes this.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
